summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York dated June 26, 2019, listing potential additional witnesses or victims in the Epstein case. It includes references to individuals with connections to Epstein's plane, social events, and modeling agencies, and notes one individual was underage in 2002.

persons.name: Sandra Perkins
persons.context: Mentioned as a contact or person of interest, associated with the law firm Boies Schiller.

persons.name: John Brockman
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with an individual and the year 2002.

persons.name: Vincent
persons.context: Identified as the father of a potential witness/victim, through whom contact information may be available.

connections.description: The unnamed individual is a frequent flier on Epstein's plane, attended dinners, and flew with him to the Bahamas.
Mentioned in connection with the year 2002, suggesting an association.
Vincent is identified as the father of the unnamed individual.

events.title: Flight to the Bahamas
events.description: An unnamed individual flew with Jeffrey Epstein to the Bahamas.

events.title: Underage association
events.description: An individual was underage at the time of their association with Epstein and others in 2002.

keyFacts: The document is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the SDNY discussing potential additional witnesses/victims, indicating an active investigation in June 2019.
It references an individual who was a frequent flier on Epstein's plane, attended dinners, and flew with him to the Bahamas on June 21, 2002.
It notes that an individual associated with Epstein and John Brockman in 2002 was underage at the time.
The document mentions connections to modeling agencies (Karin Models, MC2) and an entry in Epstein's 'black book'.
Contact information for a potential witness/victim is noted as possibly available through their father, Vincent.
